-ODE XX. To MAECENAS.

UR common Sabine wine shall be The only drink I’ll give to thee, In modest goblets too ; ’Twas stored in crock of Grecian delf, Dear knight Maecenas, by myself, That very day, when through The theatre thy plaudits tang, And sportive echo caught the clang, And answered from the banks Of thine own dear paternal stream, Whilst Vatican renewed the theme Of homage and of thanks Ξ Old Caecuban, the very best, And juice in vats Calenian pressed You drink at home, I know: My cups no choice Falernian fills, Nor unto them do Formia’s hius Impart a tempered glow-
